Tumpukan Sampah di Kali Jambe Bekasi Dibersihkan Besok Pagi
01 Nov 2019, 10:09 by Isal Mawardi
Bekasi - Hamparan sampah kembali memenuhi Kali Jambe, Kabupaten Bekasi. Pejabat setempat bakal mengangkut sampah-sampah itu besok pagi.
"Sabtu. Dari pagilah sekitar jam 08.00 WIB (atau) jam 09.00," ujar Camat Tambun Utara, Dodo Rosika, saat dikonfirmasi detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Diketahui, Pemkab Bekasi bersama camat dan kepala desa setempat melakukan rapat bersama terkait penanganan sampah di Kali Jambe, kemarin (31/10). Dodo menyebut pengangkutan sampah akan melibatkan alat berat.
"Itu kan agak dalem ya. Jadi gini, kita perlu alat backhoe. Ngambil dari sungai lalu dibawa oleh mobil truk. Kita buang sementara karena TPA Burangkeng sudah overload, jadi sementara kita menggunakan bahu sungai yang perlu diurug. Jadi tanah urugan diratakan dulu," ujar Dodo.
Peralatan pengangkutan sampah dan alat berat disokong oleh Pemkab Bekasi. "Dari PUPR backhoe 2 dari DLH (Dinas Lingkungan Hidup) bidang kebersihan itu 10 truk sampah sama petugas," ujar Dodo.
Ke depan, Dodo berencana membuat jaring pembatas. Jaring pembatas itu dimaksud untuk menahan sampah dari luar wilayah Tambun Utara agar tak menumpuk kembali di Kali Jambe.
"(Rencana) di batas antara Kecamatan Tambun Utara dengan Kecamatan Tambun Selatan," ujar Dodo. Namun, Dodo belum bisa memastikan berapa banyak jaring dan kapan jaring-jaring itu akan dipasang.
Sampah kembali memenuhi Kali Jambe sejak Senin (28/10). Sampah datang usai Kabupaten Bekasi diguyur hujan. Panjang hamparan sampah mencapai 200 meter dengan kedalaman sekitar 2 meter.
Kali Jambe sempat viral awal September lalu karena dipadati sampah. Setelah ramai diperbincangkan, Pemkab Bekasi turun membersihkan sampah-sampah tersebut.

Garbage Piles in Bekasi Jambe River Cleaned Tomorrow Morning
Nov 01 2019, 10:09 by Isal Mawardi
Bekasi - Overlays of garbage fill the Jambe River, Bekasi Regency. Local officials will transport the trash tomorrow morning.
"Saturday. From this morning around 08.00 WIB (or) at 09.00," said the North Tambun District Head, Dodo Rosika, when confirmed detikcom, Friday (11/01/2019).
It is known, Bekasi Regency Government together with the subdistrict head and the local village head held a joint meeting related to the handling of garbage in the Jambe River, yesterday (31/10). Dodo said that transportation of rubbish would involve heavy equipment.
"That's a bit inside. So, we need a backhoe. Take it from the river and then brought by a truck. We dump it temporarily because the Burangkeng landfill has overloaded, so while we use the shoulder of the river that needs to be filled in. So the Urugan soil is leveled first," Dodo said.
Garbage transportation equipment and heavy equipment are supported by Bekasi Regency Government. "From the PUPR backhoe 2 from DLH (Department of the Environment) in the field of cleanliness, 10 garbage trucks and officers," Dodo said.
Looking ahead, Dodo plans to make a barrier net. The boundary net is intended to hold waste from outside the North Tambun area so that it does not pile up again in the Jambe River.
"(The plan) is at the boundary between Kecamatan Tambun Utara and Kecamatan Tambun Selatan," Dodo said. However, Dodo could not be sure how many nets and when the nets will be installed.
Trash has returned to the Jambe River since Monday (10/28). Garbage came after the Bekasi District was washed down by rain. The length of garbage reaches 200 meters with a depth of about 2 meters.
Kali Jambe went viral in early September because it was full of garbage. After much discussion, Bekasi Regency Government went down to clean up the garbage.
